articles.headline: Vaccination Campaign at Nursing Homes Faces Obstacles and Confusion
articles.snippet: Walgreens and CVS staff will soon begin vaccinations at tens of thousands of long-term care facilities. Some staff and residents are wary, and there are thorny issues of consent.
articles.abstract: Walgreens and CVS staff will soon begin vaccinations at tens of thousands of long-term care facilities. Some staff and residents are wary, and there are thorny issues of consent.
articles.lead_paragraph: In coming days, squads of CVS and Walgreens employees, clad in protective gear and carrying small coolers, will begin to arrive at tens of thousands of nursing homes and assisted-living facilities to vaccinate staff and residents against the coronavirus.
articles.byline: By Rebecca Robbins and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

articles.headline: As China Tracked Muslims, Alibaba Showed Customers How They Could, Too
articles.snippet: The website for the tech titan’s cloud business described facial recognition software that could detect members of a minority group whose persecution has drawn international condemnation.
articles.abstract: The website for the tech titan’s cloud business described facial recognition software that could detect members of a minority group whose persecution has drawn international condemnation.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the Chinese government tracked and persecuted members of predominantly Muslim minority groups, the technology giant Alibaba taught its corporate customers how they could play a part.

articles.headline: Are We Ready to Laugh About Covid-19? A British Sitcom Hopes So
articles.snippet: With ‘Pandemonium,’ the BBC is betting that an audience will find humor in reliving the ordeals of a very awful year.
articles.abstract: With ‘Pandemonium,’ the BBC is betting that an audience will find humor in reliving the ordeals of a very awful year.
articles.lead_paragraph: A British family is walking along a frigid beach, treating a fall vacation like it’s a restaurant entree everyone wants to send back to the kitchen. The whole expedition is a lame Plan B. The Jessups were originally going to Disneyland, followed by three days of hiking at Yosemite. Then the coronavirus struck and sunny California was out of the question. Now the clan is making do in Margate, a forlorn British seaside town that peaked decades ago.

articles.headline: 10 States Accuse Google of Abusing Monopoly in Online Ads
articles.snippet: The suit focuses on the advertisements that generate a vast majority of the company’s profits.
articles.abstract: The suit focuses on the advertisements that generate a vast majority of the company’s profits.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ten state attorneys general on Wednesday accused Google of illegally abusing its monopoly over the technology that delivers ads online, adding to the company’s legal troubles with a case that strikes at the heart of its business.
articles.byline: By David McCabe and Daisuke Wakabayashi

articles.headline: Facebook Takes the Gloves Off in Feud With Apple
articles.snippet: The social network said it opposed changes that Apple was making to the tracking of apps and would provide information for an antitrust complaint against the iPhone maker.
articles.abstract: The social network said it opposed changes that Apple was making to the tracking of apps and would provide information for an antitrust complaint against the iPhone maker.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, signs of discord have brewed between Facebook and Apple.
articles.byline: By Jack Nicas and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: Staring Down Deadline, Congress Nears $900 Billion Stimulus Deal
articles.snippet: The emerging compromise would provide emergency stimulus payments, jobless aid and rental assistance, extending help to businesses and funding the distribution of a vaccine. But more is likely to be needed.
articles.abstract: The emerging compromise would provide emergency stimulus payments, jobless aid and rental assistance, extending help to businesses and funding the distribution of a vaccine. But more is likely to be needed.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After months of stalemate, congressional leaders were on the verge on Wednesday of cementing a roughly $900 billion stimulus deal to deliver emergency aid to individuals and companies devastated by the toll of the worsening pandemic, racing to finish the details and stave off a government shutdown on Friday.

articles.headline: Biden’s Inaugural Will Be Mostly Virtual, but Money From Donors Will Be Real
articles.snippet: The president-elect’s allies have begun an ambitious fund-raising campaign for the celebration of his swearing-in. Big donors will get “virtual signed photos” — and a chance to generate good will.
articles.abstract: The president-elect’s allies have begun an ambitious fund-raising campaign for the celebration of his swearing-in. Big donors will get “virtual signed photos” — and a chance to generate good will.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s allies have begun an ambitious campaign to raise millions of dollars from corporations and individuals by offering special “V.I.P. participation” in reimagined inaugural festivities that will be largely virtual because of the coronavirus pandemic.
articles.byline: By Kenneth P. Vogel and Eric Lipton

articles.headline: Workers Tap Retirement Savings as a Last Resort
articles.snippet: At least two million workers have turned to their workplace retirement plans for cash under temporary rules created during the pandemic. But so far, most people have left their accounts alone.
articles.abstract: At least two million workers have turned to their workplace retirement plans for cash under temporary rules created during the pandemic. But so far, most people have left their accounts alone.
articles.lead_paragraph: About a month into the pandemic, Tyler Mathiesen lost his position at a tech company, his first full-time job out of college. For several months, everything was fine: Payments on his $75,000 in student loans were paused, and the extra $600 weekly federal unemployment benefit helped pay the rest. He even managed to save some money.
